Upon his arrival in Armadillo, he makes his way to the saloon, where he meets Jake. Jake knows where one of Marston's men has been sent to kill is and provides Marston with a horse and guide services to get him to Fort Mercer. Once there, Marston comes face to face with <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/bill-williamson/3005-15620/\">Bill Williamson</a>, a former brother-in-arms. Marston tries to reason with him, not wanting any bloodshed, but Williamson will not listen and shoots Marston in the abdomen and leaves him to die outside the gates of the Fort. Sometime after being left for dead, a wagon comes by, and we see Marston's body being loaded into its back.</p><h3>New Austin</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30036/1377468-rsg_5f00_rdr_5f00_screenshot_5f00_378.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1377468\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.55703125\" data-width=\"1280\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 1280px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:55.7%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30036/1377468-rsg_5f00_rdr_5f00_screenshot_5f00_378.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1377468\"><img alt=\"John Marston with a bandana\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/30036/1377468-rsg_5f00_rdr_5f00_screenshot_5f00_378.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1377468-rsg_5f00_rdr_5f00_screenshot_5f00_378.jpg 1280w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/3/30036/1377468-rsg_5f00_rdr_5f00_screenshot_5f00_378.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/3/30036/1377468-rsg_5f00_rdr_5f00_screenshot_5f00_378.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/30036/1377468-rsg_5f00_rdr_5f00_screenshot_5f00_378.jpg 320w\"><noscript><img alt=\"John Marston with a bandana\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/30036/1377468-rsg_5f00_rdr_5f00_screenshot_5f00_378.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1377468-rsg_5f00_rdr_5f00_screenshot_5f00_378.jpg 1280w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/3/30036/1377468-rsg_5f00_rdr_5f00_screenshot_5f00_378.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/3/30036/1377468-rsg_5f00_rdr_5f00_screenshot_5f00_378.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/30036/1377468-rsg_5f00_rdr_5f00_screenshot_5f00_378.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></noscript></a><figcaption>John Marston with a bandana</figcaption></figure><p>Marston wakes up and finds out that Bonnie MacFarlane saved him. Bonnie takes care of John, and John helps her out by going on night watches with her or herding cattle. John tells her that he must catch Bill because people (the government) hold his family hostage. John also heads down to the local town, Armadillo, and meets the local sheriff, <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/leigh-johnson/3005-13939/\">Marshal Johnson</a>. The Marshall tells him that he would like to take down Bill and his gang, but Fort Mercer is out of his jurisdiction. John helps him out anyway and ends up once again meeting Bill, who manages to escape.</p><p>Marston also comes across <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/nigel-west-dickens/3005-14591/\">Nigel West Dickens</a>, a traveling salesman. After John saves his life, Dickens offers to help John get inside Fort Mercer. He plans to build a \"Trojan Horse.\" They will sneak their way inside unnoticed and then wreak havoc, like in Homer's epic story. To prepare for such a plan, John must first get money (by racing and promoting Dicken's \"magic\" elixir), and a government certified gatling gun. To do all this, he must work with Dicken's friends: <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/seth-briars/3005-14589/\">Seth</a> and <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/irish/3005-15818/\">Irish</a>. After many fetch quests and odd jobs, they finally manage to pull it off and enter Fort Mercer with Marshall's help. After tearing up the place, they discover Williamson has fled to Mexico to hide with former gang member <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/javier-escuella/3005-16038/\">Javier Escuella</a>. Marston hops on Irish's ferry and heads for Mexico.</p><h3>Mexico</h3><p>After a \"warm\" welcome into Mexico, Marston discovers a country ravaged by civil war, a war between the totalitarian government and the rebels. He goes to work for both the rebels and the government who both promise him that they'll help him find the men he's looking for. He starts to work with <a href=\"/landon-ricketts/3005-15511/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15511\"> Landon Ricketts</a>, an old gun slinger who tries to help him find the two fugitives but fails, instead they save a young lady called <a href=\"/luisa-fortuna/3005-15591/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15591\"> Luisa</a>. Landon tells Marston that Luisa is deep in the rebel movement (being the so called bride to be of <a href=\"/abraham-reyes/3005-15590/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15590\"> Abraham Reyes,</a> the leader of the rebels) and can help to find his men. After saving Reyes, the rebel leader tells Marston that his spies will find his men in no time.</p><figure data-align=\"left\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/10/104968/1497691-rdr_0379.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1497691\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.56779661016949\" data-width=\"590\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 590px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.8%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/10/104968/1497691-rdr_0379.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1497691\"><img alt=\"Colonel Allende (left) and Captain De Santa\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/10/104968/1497691-rdr_0379.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/10/104968/1497691-rdr_0379.jpg 590w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/10/104968/1497691-rdr_0379.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/10/104968/1497691-rdr_0379.jpg 320w\"><noscript><img alt=\"Colonel Allende (left) and Captain De Santa\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/10/104968/1497691-rdr_0379.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/10/104968/1497691-rdr_0379.jpg 590w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/10/104968/1497691-rdr_0379.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/10/104968/1497691-rdr_0379.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></noscript></a><figcaption>Colonel Allende (left) and Captain De Santa</figcaption></figure><p>After a \"warm\" welcome into Mexico, Marston discovers a country ravaged by civil war, a war between the totalitarian government and the rebels. He goes to work for both the rebels and the government, who promise him that they will help him find the men he is looking for. He starts to work with <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/landon-ricketts/3005-15511/\">Landon Ricketts</a>, an old gunslinger who tries to help him find the two fugitives but fails; instead, they save a young lady called <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/luisa-fortuna/3005-15591/\">Luisa</a>. Landon tells Marston that Luisa is deep in the rebel movement (being the so-called bride to be of <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/abraham-reyes/3005-15590/\">Abraham Reyes,</a> the rebels' leader) and can help find his men. After saving Reyes, the rebel leader tells Marston that his spies will find his men in no time.</p><p>While this is all happening, Marston is also working for the corrupt government led by <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/colonel-allende/3005-16351/\">Colonel Allende</a>. This government hunts down and kills the rebels, even if it means destroying innocent towns. They also capture and rape the country's women. Marston mostly works with Captain Vincente De Santa, a low-life army thug sent out to do Allende's dirty work. After doing a certain number of jobs for the government, Allende tells him that Bill and Javier have been spotted in a town and that it was time for John to enact his revenge. However, upon arriving at the deserted town, De Santa turns on him. As Marston is about to be executed, Reyes and his band of rebels arrive and save the day. Reyes being fully aware that Marston was helping the government, decides that John must prove his worth before Reyes is willing to give him intel. One train robbery later and after putting a bullet in De Santa, Reyes tells Marston that the government had been hiding the two outlaws the entire time. Marston raids a government fort with the rebels but only finds Escuella, whom he delivers to his superiors, or Marston can choose to kill him. After all this, Reyes decides to conduct a full-blown revolution against Allende, who is hiding out with Williamson. After a stagecoach chase, Reyes kills Allende and John kills Williamson. Reyes takes control of the country while John's superiors ask him to go after <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/dutch-van-der-linde/3005-15727/\">Dutch</a>, the gang's ex-boss who is hiding out in Blackwater.</p><h3>Blackwater</h3><p>After arriving in Blackwater, Marston informs <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/edgar-ross/3005-13940/\">Edgar Ross</a> of Williamson's demise. Unfortunately, Ross now orders Marston to go after <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/dutch-van-der-linde/3005-15727/\">Dutch Van Der Linde</a>, the former leader of Marston's gang, in order for him to see his family again. Van Der Linde has taken up arms with a group of Native Americans in the area to fight against the US Army and/or commit violent crimes. Marston is eventually lead to a Native American informant named <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/nastas/3005-15990/\">Nastas</a>, who also helps track down Van Der Linde, but is found out, and Marston rescues him. He takes him back to a Yale Anthropology Professor named <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/harold-macdougal/3005-16603/\">Harold MacDougal</a>, who is on a forced sabbatical from Yale. He is supposed to get Van Der Linde's whereabouts from Nastas but is forced to flee back east when Nastas is shot in the head and killed by Van Der Linde's gang during a supposedly peaceful meeting. Marston eventually teams up with the US Army and tracks down Van Der Linde to his camp. After a long chase, Van Der Linde is trapped on a cliff. He tells Marston that he and Marston have lived out their usefulness in a rapidly progressing world, and faced with the choice of cooperating or death at Marston's hands; he throws himself from the clifftop to his death.</p><h3>Marston's Ranch</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34651/1454503-ross2.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1454503\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.3840830449827\" data-width=\"867\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 867px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:138.4%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/34651/1454503-ross2.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1454503\"><img alt=\"Agent Edgar Ross\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 462px) 100vw, 462px\" data-width=\"462\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/34651/1454503-ross2.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/34651/1454503-ross2.jpg 867w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/3/34651/1454503-ross2.jpg 693w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/34651/1454503-ross2.jpg 462w\"><noscript><img alt=\"Agent Edgar Ross\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/34651/1454503-ross2.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/34651/1454503-ross2.jpg 867w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/3/34651/1454503-ross2.jpg 693w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/34651/1454503-ross2.jpg 462w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 462px) 100vw, 462px\" data-width=\"462\"></noscript></a><figcaption>Agent Edgar Ross</figcaption></figure><p>Fulfilling his duty to his country, Marston settles down at his ranch alongside his wife <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/abigail-marston/3005-15598/\">Abigail</a> and son, <a href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/jack-marston/3005-15562/\">Jack</a>, as well as the charismatic drunkard, Uncle. Starting at the ranch again, he acquires some cattle from the MacFarlanes and breaks wild horses. He also takes his son on several hunting trips. Unfortunately, their happiness is shattered when the US Army and Edgar Ross come and attack their ranch. Uncle is shot and killed, leaving only John and Jack Marston to defend the ranch. Outnumbered, the Marstons take refuge in their barn, and John tells Abigail and Jack to get on a horse and ride as far away as they possibly can. After they have left, John comes out of his hiding place and tries to take out as many men as possible. Unfortunately, he is shot multiple times by the remaining men, and he falls over dead. Abigail and Jack hear the gunshots and return to their ranch to find John dead. They bury him on the hill above the ranch, next to Uncle. The story then shifts from 1911 to 1914 to reveal that Abigail has also died. A figure picks up the hat from John Marston's grave, and as the camera turns, he is revealed to be Jack Marston, all grown up and ready to take up his father's role in the world.</p><h3>Optional Ending</h3><p>Upon completion of John's story, players can search for Edgar Ross to exact revenge upon him for the murder of his father, despite his compliance with the federal requests. Edgar Ross has peacefully retired and is on a hunting trip to Mexico, after having won a chestful of medals for his work against Marston's gang. Jack tracks Edgar down and engages him in a duel. Upon killing Ross, the 'true' ending to the game is achieved. The final newspaper contains the following stories:</p><ul><li>Seth has grown rich from hunting for treasure.</li><li>Marshal Leigh Johnson peacefully retired and left the New Austin region.</li><li>Irish shot himself dead in an outhouse while inebriated.</li><li>Landon Ricketts died peacefully in his sleep.</li><li>Harold MacDougal attacked another professor with a croquet mallet, resulting in his removal from Yale University.</li><li>Abraham Reyes has achieved presidency in Mexico - and his people now consider him a tyrant.</li></ul><h2>Downloadable Content</h2><h3>Outlaws To The End Co-Op Mission Pack</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/2229181-otte_raft.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2229181\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"640\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 640px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/2229181-otte_raft.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2229181\"><img alt=\"Grab three comrades for your posse and take on the Wild West!\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2229181-otte_raft.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/8/87790/2229181-otte_raft.jpg 640w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/8/87790/2229181-otte_raft.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2229181-otte_raft.jpg 320w\"><noscript><img alt=\"Grab three comrades for your posse and take on the Wild West!\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2229181-otte_raft.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/8/87790/2229181-otte_raft.jpg 640w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/8/87790/2229181-otte_raft.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2229181-otte_raft.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></noscript></a><figcaption>Grab three comrades for your posse and take on the Wild West!</figcaption></figure><p>Released for free on June 22, 2010, the Outlaws To The End Co-Op Mission Pack is the first official downloadable content, adding a new <a href=\"/cooperative-play/3015-108/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-108\">co-operative</a> mission mode for use in multiplayer outside of Free Roam mode.</p><p>Up to four players at a time can tackle up to each of the six co-operative missions (including various objectives spread across the game world) as one of 4-5 different character classes. After successfully clearing each mission, players can unlock harder versions of these missions (known as Advanced Co-Op Missions, which include deadlier enemies and forced expert targeting).</p><p>The DLC includes new experience rewards for multiplayer, as well as 10 <a href=\"/achievements/3015-29/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-29\">achievements</a> (for the Xbox 360 version, worth 100 gamerscore) or bronze <a href=\"/playstation-trophies/3015-198/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-198\">trophies</a> (for the PlayStation 3 version).</p><h4>Character Classes</h4><p>Before starting each mission, players join a lobby where they can pick from one of four (or five, if they are playing an advanced mission) character classes. Each class starts with a different assortment of weapons, and has no visual or status differences.</p><ul><li><b>Soldier</b> - Basic general-purpose class. Armed with a Volcanic Pistol and a Winchester Repeater (Evans Repeater in advanced missions).</li></ul><ul><li><b>Miner</b> - Close-range specialty class. Armed with a Schofield Revolver, Pump-action Shotgun (Semi-auto Shotgun in advanced missions), and Dynamite.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Marksman</b> - Long-range specialty class. Armed with a Cattleman Revolver, Rolling Block Rifle (Carcano Rifle in advanced missions), and Throwing Knives.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Gunslinger</b> - Medium-range specialty class. Armed with a Double-action Revolver (High Power Pistol in advanced missions), Repeater Carbine, and Fire Bottles.</li></ul><ul><li><b>No Holds Barred</b> - Special class for advanced missions only. Armed with everything the player has unlocked (not picked up) in multiplayer.</li></ul><h4>Missions</h4><p>The pack includes six co-operative missions, each with their own unique storyline and objectives. None of the missions tie-in with each other (story wise), and while the mission rotation is the same, players can opt to skip or repeat any mission.</p><ul><li><b>The Escape -</b> Walton's Gang is trading a large stash of gold for weapons and ammunition with the Mexican Army at The Scratching Post. The outlaws are recruited by the US Army to stop the deal and confiscate the gold stash using a stagecoach. After delivering the coach to the US Army in Benedict Point, the outlaws then clear out Walton's Gang from the ghost town of Tumbleweed and return, only to find out that politics get ugly and the outlaws are labeled traitors by the US Army. The outlaws decide to steal the gold for themselves and escape to Mexico.</li></ul><ul><li><b>The Kidnapped Girl</b> - Bandits have taken control over Fort Mercer and has kidnapped the daughter of a local farmer. The outlaws decide to storm the gates of the fort, clearing the place out while rescue the girl. After that, they transport her to her home at Ridgewood Farm by stagecoach while being attacked by bandit reinforcements.</li></ul><ul><li><b>The Herd</b> - Cattle rustlers have taken control of a local cattleman's herd and have taken refuge at Pike's Basin. The outlaws are hired to fight their way into the canyon, clear out the rustles, and herd the cattle back to Armadillo (while being attacked by more rustlers).</li></ul><ul><li><b>The River</b> - The outlaws ride a raft downstream along the US and Mexican border, taking out bandit encampments along the way, until they reach Nosalida. After reaching the settlement, they must drive the Mexican Army out by destroying their supplies.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Ammunition</b> - The Mexican Army has the settlement of Tesoro Azul under siege, with the outlaws still inside! Players must defend the town from soldiers while deadly artillery bombardments rains from a tall nearby hill. After clearing the enemy attack, they must infiltrate the hill and blow up the artillery emplacement.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Walton's Gold</b> - Walton's Gang has taken control of the gold mine in Gaptooth Breach. In an effort to make a fortune in the Wild West, the outlaws must infiltrate the mine, stash as many bags of gold as they can in a mine cart, and escape with the cart as the mine is ready to collapse.</li></ul><h3>Legends and Killers Pack</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30036/1440118-legendskillers2.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1440118\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"1280\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 1280px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30036/1440118-legendskillers2.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1440118\"><img alt=\"Red Harlow and gang return for a good ol'fashioned multiplayer brawl.\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/30036/1440118-legendskillers2.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1440118-legendskillers2.jpg 1280w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/3/30036/1440118-legendskillers2.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/3/30036/1440118-legendskillers2.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/30036/1440118-legendskillers2.jpg 320w\"><noscript><img alt=\"Red Harlow and gang return for a good ol'fashioned multiplayer brawl.\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/30036/1440118-legendskillers2.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1440118-legendskillers2.jpg 1280w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/3/30036/1440118-legendskillers2.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/3/30036/1440118-legendskillers2.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/30036/1440118-legendskillers2.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></noscript></a><figcaption>Red Harlow and gang return for a good ol'fashioned multiplayer brawl.</figcaption></figure><p>Released for $9.99 on August 10, 2010, the Legends and Killers Pack is the second official downloadable content, adding nine new maps for all competitive multiplayer modes, a new throwable weapon (the Tomahawk) for both single-player and multi-player, and eight new multiplayer characters (all from the 2004 predecessor, <a href=\"/red-dead-revolver/3030-8440/\" data-ref-id=\"3030-8440\">Red Dead Revolver</a>).</p><p>The DLC includes new experience rewards for both singleplayer and multiplayer (relating to the Tomahawk weapon), as well as 10 achievements (for the Xbox 360 version, worth 100 gamerscore) or trophies (for the PlayStation 3 version, nine bronze trophies and one silver trophy).</p><h4>Competitive Multiplayer Maps</h4><ul><li>Blackwater</li><li>Escalera</li><li>Fort Mercer</li><li>Hennigan's Steed</li><li>Manzanita Post</li><li>Punta Orgullo</li><li>Rio Bravo</li><li>Tall Trees</li><li>Thieves' Landing</li></ul><h4>Multiplayer Characters (Legendary)</h4><ul><li><a href=\"/red-harlow/3005-2809/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2809\">Red Harlow</a></li><li><a href=\"/jack-swift/3005-2814/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2814\">Jack Swift</a></li><li><a href=\"/mr-kelley/3005-16276/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16276\">Mr. Kelley</a></li><li><a href=\"/annie-stoakes/3005-10607/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-10607\">Annie Stoakes</a></li><li><a href=\"/buffalo-soldier/3005-11508/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-11508\">Buffalo Soldier</a></li><li><a href=\"/shadow-wolf/3005-2816/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-2816\">Shadow Wolf</a></li><li><a href=\"/ugly-chris/3005-16275/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16275\">Ugly Chris</a></li><li><a href=\"/pig-josh/3005-15972/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15972\">Pig Josh</a></li></ul><h3>Liars and Cheats Pack</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30036/1520789-stronghold2.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1520789\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"1280\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 1280px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30036/1520789-stronghold2.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1520789\"><img alt=\"A game of Stronghold in session.\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/30036/1520789-stronghold2.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1520789-stronghold2.jpg 1280w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/3/30036/1520789-stronghold2.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/3/30036/1520789-stronghold2.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/30036/1520789-stronghold2.jpg 320w\"><noscript><img alt=\"A game of Stronghold in session.\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/30036/1520789-stronghold2.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1520789-stronghold2.jpg 1280w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/3/30036/1520789-stronghold2.jpg 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/3/30036/1520789-stronghold2.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/30036/1520789-stronghold2.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></noscript></a><figcaption>A game of Stronghold in session.</figcaption></figure><p>Released $9.99 on September 21, 2010, the Liars and Cheats Pack is the third official downloadable content, adding two new competitive multiplayer game modes (Stronghold and Grand Prix), a new scoped rifle (the Explosive Rifle) for both single-player and multi-player, seven new multiplayer Gang Hideouts, three new multiplayer Free Roam activities (Hunting Grounds, Poker, and Liar's Dice), and fifteen new multiplayer characters (all from the single-player campaign).</p><p>The DLC includes new experience rewards for both singleplayer (relating to the Explosive Rifle weapon) and multiplayer, as well as 15 achievements (for the Xbox 360 version, worth 150 gamerscore) or 10 trophies (for the PlayStation 3 version, seven bronze trophies and three silver trophies).</p><p> </p><h4>Stronghold Mode</h4><p>Stronghold is a competitive multiplayer game mode with both an attacking team (who must capture a series of objectives with a limited number of lives and a time limit) and a defending team (who must guard each objective with an unlimited number of lives and a longer respawn period). Each match includes two rounds (in which the teams switch their roles for the second round), and the winners of the match is determined by the number of objectives captured and the time taken to capture them.</p><p>There are four/five objectives in each map, and only one objective at a time can be captured. The more attacking team members at the objective, the quicker the capture. The capture timer slowly returns down to zero if no attacking team member are at the objective area.</p><p>The Liars and Cheats Pack includes four maps for Stronghold:</p><ul><li>Blackwater</li><li>Escalera</li><li>Fort Mercer</li><li>Thieves' Landing</li></ul><p>This mode was later made available for free (with a new set of maps) in the Myths and Mavericks DLC.</p><h4>Grand Prix Mode</h4><p>Grand Prix is a competitive multiplayer game mode where up to eight players race against each other on horseback. There are three circuits, each with different amounts of races. After each race in the circuit, players are scored by their position (10 points for first, 8 points for second, 6 points for third, etc.) and the player with the most points at the end of the circuit wins.</p><p>Each player starts with the Schofield Revolver, Pump-action Shotgun, and Hunting Knife. After the first ten seconds of any race, the weapons can be used to shoot opponents of their horses. If a player or their horse is killed, they respawn shortly at the point of death.</p><ul><li><b>Rathskeller Series</b> (short circuit) - Rathskellar Run, Saint's Sprint, and Boulder Dash.</li><li><b>Carreras Perdido Cup</b> (medium circuit) - Carrera del Diablo, Ridge Racin', L. Johnson's Run, and Coronas Paradise.</li><li><b>N. Johns Invitational</b> (long circuit) - Tall Trees Trail, Rio Run, Manzanita Mile, Boulder Dash, and Sidewinder Breeze.</li></ul><h4>Gang Hideouts</h4><p>Players without the Liars and Cheats Pack can still fight alongside those who do. However, they cannot activate the gang hideouts and won't earn any additional experience points for clearing these hideouts. Alongside experience points, players with the DLC gain an Explosive Rifle and five Explosive Rounds for clearing any of these hideouts.</p><ul><li>Critchley's Ranch</li><li>Crooked Toes</li><li>Cueva Seca</li><li>Rancho Polvo</li><li>The Scratching Post</li><li>Venter's Place</li><li>Warthington Ranch</li></ul><h4>Hunting Grounds</h4><p>Hunting Grounds are designated locations in multiplayer Free Roam (similar to Gang Hideouts) where players can earn experience points by hunting a particular type of animal. After a certain amount of animals are killed, a stronger \"legendary animal\" appears.</p><ul><li>Broken Tree (<a href=\"/boar/3015-3122/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3122\">boars</a>)</li><li>Rio del Lobo (<a href=\"/wolf/3015-2265/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2265\">wolves</a>)</li><li>Roca de Madera (<a href=\"/bobcat/3015-7216/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-7216\">bobcats</a>)</li><li>Silent Stead (<a href=\"/cougars/3015-2606/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2606\">cougars</a>)</li></ul><h4>Multiplayer Characters (Redemption)</h4><ul><li><a href=\"/seth-briars/3005-14589/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-14589\">Seth Briars</a></li><li><a href=\"/nigel-west-dickens/3005-14591/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-14591\">Nigel West Dickens</a></li><li><a href=\"/luisa-fortuna/3005-15591/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15591\">Luisa Fortuna</a></li><li><a href=\"/leigh-johnson/3005-13939/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-13939\">Leigh Johnson</a></li><li><a href=\"/bonnie-macfarlane/3005-14588/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-14588\">Bonnie MacFarlane</a></li><li><a href=\"/abigail-marston/3005-15598/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15598\">Abigail Marston</a></li><li><a href=\"/jack-marston/3005-15562/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15562\">Jack Marston</a> (adult, Cowboy Outfit)</li><li><a href=\"/john-marston/3005-9449/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-9449\">John Marston</a> (Cowboy Outfit)</li></ul><h4>Multiplayer Characters (Damnation)</h4><ul><li><a href=\"/colonel-allende/3005-16351/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16351\">Agustin Allende</a></li><li><a href=\"/irish/3005-15818/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15818\">Irish</a></li><li><a href=\"/dutch-van-der-linde/3005-15727/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15727\">Dutch van der Linde</a></li><li><a href=\"/harold-macdougal/3005-16603/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16603\">Harold MacDougal</a></li><li><a href=\"/abraham-reyes/3005-15590/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15590\">Abraham Reyes</a></li><li><a href=\"/edgar-ross/3005-13940/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-13940\">Edgar Ross</a></li><li><a href=\"/bill-williamson/3005-15620/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15620\">Bill Williamson</a></li></ul><h3>Hunting and Trading Pack</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/2225826-outfits1.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2225826\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.83526682134571\" data-width=\"431\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 431px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:83.5%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/2225826-outfits1.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2225826\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2225826-outfits1.png\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/8/87790/2225826-outfits1.png 431w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2225826-outfits1.png 320w\"><noscript><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2225826-outfits1.png\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/8/87790/2225826-outfits1.png 431w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2225826-outfits1.png 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></noscript></a></figure><p>Released for free on October 12, 2010, the Hunting and Trading Pack is the fourth official downloadable content, adding two new single-player outfits (and challenges to unlock them), a new rare animal (the Jackalope), and a compatibility update for multiplayer that shows the right character models (instead of a placeholder cowboy model) for players using characters from the Liars and Cheats Pack and the Legends and Killers Pack.</p><h4>Singleplayer Outfits</h4><ul><li><b>Savvy Merchant Outfit</b> - Players will be able to buy all items from any gunsmith for half the cost. Earned by winning $1000 total from gambling, making a transaction at every gunsmith, gathering $200 worth of herbs, executing 20 people, and completing \"The Prohibitionist\" Stranger side-mission.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Legendary Hunter Outfi</b>t - Players will be able to harvest double the amount of provisions from skinning animals (with the exception of hearts). Earned by harvesting 5000 lbs. of meat, killing a cougar with a stick of dynamite, killing and skinning 8 snakes, killing a legendary Jackalope, and completing \"Deadalus and Son\" Stranger side-mission.</li></ul><h3>Undead Nightmare Pack</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30036/1539190-reddeadredemptionundeadnightmarecoverart.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1539190\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1.22875\" data-width=\"800\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 800px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:122.9%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/3/30036/1539190-reddeadredemptionundeadnightmarecoverart.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1539190\"><img alt=\"Something's not right with this depiction of the game's box art...\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 520px) 100vw, 520px\" data-width=\"520\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/30036/1539190-reddeadredemptionundeadnightmarecoverart.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1539190-reddeadredemptionundeadnightmarecoverart.jpg 800w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/3/30036/1539190-reddeadredemptionundeadnightmarecoverart.jpg 781w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/30036/1539190-reddeadredemptionundeadnightmarecoverart.jpg 520w\"><noscript><img alt=\"Something's not right with this depiction of the game's box art...\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/30036/1539190-reddeadredemptionundeadnightmarecoverart.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/3/30036/1539190-reddeadredemptionundeadnightmarecoverart.jpg 800w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/3/30036/1539190-reddeadredemptionundeadnightmarecoverart.jpg 781w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/3/30036/1539190-reddeadredemptionundeadnightmarecoverart.jpg 520w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 520px) 100vw, 520px\" data-width=\"520\"></noscript></a><figcaption>Something's not right with this depiction of the game's box art...</figcaption></figure><p>Released for $9.99 on October 26th, 2010, the Undead Nightmare Pack is the fifth official downloadable content, adding a brand new single-player adventure (separate from the main campaign) where players resume the rule of John Marston as he tries to find a cure for the highly infectious plague of <a href=\"/zombie/3015-79/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-79\">zombies</a> that has spread across the frontier.</p><p>Along with new missions and side-quests, the Undead Nightmare campaign features new challenges, new random encounters, new locations, new undead animal variants, five new weapons (the Blunderbuss, Torch, Holy Water, Undead Bait, and Boom Bait), three new outfits (Undead Hunter, Union Suit, and Legend of the Apocalypse), and rare mythical creatures (including the <a href=\"/horsemen-of-the-apocalypse/3015-4533/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-4533\">Four Horses of the Apocalypse</a>, a <a href=\"/bigfoot/3015-6183/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6183\">Sasquatch</a>, a <a href=\"/chupacabra/3015-6263/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-6263\">Chupacabra</a>, and a <a href=\"/unicorn/3015-2337/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-2337\">Unicorn</a>). For multiplayer, the pack adds eight new zombie characters to use (including zombie versions of John Marston and Landon Ricketts), a new multiplayer game mode (Undead Overrun), and a new Free Roam activity (Land Grab).</p><p>The DLC includes new experience rewards for multiplayer, as well as 12 single-player achievements (for the Xbox 360 version, worth 200 gamerscore) or trophies (for the PlayStation 3 version, eleven bronze trophies and one silver trophy).</p><p> </p><h4>Undead Overrun Mode</h4><p>Undead Overrun is a co-operative <a href=\"/horde/3015-3021/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-3021\">wave-based survival mode</a>, where up to four players fight off endless waves of undead enemies. While killing every zombie is necessary to finish the wave, players must fill up a kill meter (by killing spawning zombies) before a countdown timer (which starts at three minutes for each wave) reaches zero. If the timer reaches zero before the kill meter is filled, Sudden Death mode activates (which, for the rest of the wave, strengthens the zombie horde). The game ends when all players are incapacitated. This mode comes with five maps (\"High Brains Drifter\" in Coot's Chapel, \"Undeadwood\" in Tumbleweed, \"Bury 'em Deep\" in Odd Fellow's Rest, \"Dead Man Walking\" in Blackwater, and \"Undead Django\" in Spulcro).</p><p>Like the Outlaws to the End Co-op mode, players are downed instead of immediately killed from most types of damage, and can be revived by teammates before they bleed out. In Sudden Death mode, however, players can not be revived.</p><p>Also like the Outlaws to the End Co-op mode, players start in a lobby where they choose from four classes to use in-game:</p><ul><li><b>Mauler</b> - Basic general-purpose class. Armed with a LeMat Revolver, Semi-auto Shotgun, and Henry Repeater.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Overkill</b> - Close-range specialty class. Armed with a Double-action Revolver, Pump-action Shotgun, and Dynamite.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Long Shot</b> - Long-range specialty class. Armed with a High Power Pistol, Double-barreled Shotgun, and Bolt Action Rifle.</li></ul><ul><li><b>Ravager</b> - Medium-range specialty class. Armed with a Mauser Pistol, Sawed-off Shotgun, and Dynamite.</li></ul><p>Every three waves, a new weapon appears on the map marked by a green dot. Players must grab it before the wave ends (when it disappears). The weapons are either a Semi-auto Shotgun, Evans Repeater, or Blunderbuss. When a player kills ten enemies in quick succession or becomes the last player not incapacitated, they get phosphorus bullets for 20 seconds, which engulf zombies in blue flames when shot, slowly killing them.</p><p>At the beginning of each wave, a <a href=\"/coffin/3055-1948/\" data-ref-id=\"3055-1948\">coffin</a> is spawned randomly on the map. Opening the coffin before the countdown timer runs out grants the player who opened it the following:</p><ul><li>Ammo for all of the player's weapons.</li><li>Shotgun Slugs (replacing shotgun shells with single-projectile shotgun slugs).</li><li>One minute added to the countdown timer.</li><li>Either Undead Bait or a special version of Holy Water.</li></ul><h4>Multiplayer Characters (Zombies)</h4><ul><li>Poe Boll</li><li>Viper Craven</li><li>Magic Jackson</li><li><a href=\"/john-marston/3005-9449/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-9449\">John Marston</a> (zombie)</li><li>Ishmael Raimi</li><li>Sarah Reese</li><li><a href=\"/landon-ricketts/3005-15511/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15511\">Landon Ricketts</a> (zombie)</li><li>Paco Romero</li></ul><h3>Myths and Mavericks Pack</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/2229179-mam.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2229179\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"640\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 640px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/2229179-mam.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2229179\"><img alt=\"John's gunslinger mentor, Landon Ricketts, is back to deliver more justice.\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2229179-mam.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/8/87790/2229179-mam.jpg 640w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/8/87790/2229179-mam.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2229179-mam.jpg 320w\"><noscript><img alt=\"John's gunslinger mentor, Landon Ricketts, is back to deliver more justice.\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2229179-mam.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/8/87790/2229179-mam.jpg 640w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/8/87790/2229179-mam.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2229179-mam.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></noscript></a><figcaption>John's gunslinger mentor, Landon Ricketts, is back to deliver more justice.</figcaption></figure><p>Released for free on September 13, 2011, the Myths and Mavericks Pack is the sixth and final official downloadable content, adding thirteen maps for certain competitive multiplayer modes (including ten new maps), free access to the Stronghold competitive multiplayer game mode, eight new multiplayer characters (all from the single-player campaign), three new multiplayer playlists, and a compatibility update for multiplayer that shows the right character models (instead of a placeholder cowboy model) for players using characters from the Undead Nightmare Pack.</p><h4>Competitive Multiplayer Maps</h4><p>Each of the maps in this DLC include features not present in any previously-released map. These include dangerous animals (bears, boars, and cougars) that attack players during the match, different weapons in the match standoff (including shotguns and tomahawks), and the spawning of the Explosive Rifle in any game mode.</p><ul><li><b>Armadillo</b> - Stronghold</li><li><b>Beecher's Hope</b> (new map) - Stronghold</li><li><b>Benedict Point</b> (new map) - Grab the Bag, Hold Your Own</li><li><b>Chuparosa</b> - Stonghold</li><li><b>Cochinay</b> (new map) - Gang Shootout, Gold Rush, Shootout, Stronghold</li><li><b>El Presidio</b> (new map) - Gang Shootout, Gold Rush, Shootout</li><li><b>Gaptooth Breach</b> (new map) - Gang Shootout, Shootout</li><li><b>Nekoti Rock</b> (new map) - Gang Shootout, Gold Rush, Shootout</li><li><b>Perdido</b> (new map) - Grab the Bag, Hold Your Own</li><li><b>Pike's Basin</b> (new map) - Gang Shootout, Gold Rush, Shootout</li><li><b>Rio Bravo</b> (from the Legends and Killers Pack) - Gang Shootout, Shootout</li><li><b>Torquemada</b> (new map) - Stronghold</li><li><b>Tumbleweed</b> - Stronghold</li></ul><h4>Multiplayer Playlists</h4><p>Originally, the Myths and Mavericks Team Games and Myths and Mavericks Hardcore Team Games playlists were Myths and Mavericks Gang Matches (which consisted of Gang Shootout, Grab the Bag, and Hold Your Own modes in the Myths and Mavericks Pack maps) and Myths and Mavericks Stronghold (which consisted of Stronghold mode in the Myths and Mavericks Pack maps). Ten days after the pack was released, Rockstar San Diego merged the Stronghold playlist with the Gang Matches playlist and split it into normal and hardcore playlists.</p><ul><li><b>Myths and Mavericks Free For All</b> - Gold Rush and Shootout modes on Myths and Mavericks Pack maps. Alternates between normal and hardcore modes on a weekly basis.</li><li><b>Myths and Mavericks Team Games</b> - Gang Shootout, Grab the Bag, Hold Your Own, and Stronghold on Myths and Mavericks Pack maps. Normal mode.</li><li><b>Myths and Mavericks Hardcore Team Games</b> - Gang Shootout, Grab the Bag, Hold Your Own, and Stronghold on Myths and Mavericks Pack maps. Hardcore mode.</li></ul><h4>Multiplayer Characters (Revolution)</h4><ul><li><a href=\"/drew-macfarlane/3005-23015/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-23015\">Drew MacFarlane</a></li><li>Eli</li><li><a href=\"/javier-escuella/3005-16038/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16038\">Javier Escuella</a></li><li>Jonah</li><li><a href=\"/landon-ricketts/3005-15511/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15511\">Landon Ricketts</a></li><li><a href=\"/nastas/3005-15990/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-15990\">Nastas</a></li><li><a href=\"/uncle/3005-16598/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-16598\">Uncle</a></li><li><a href=\"/vincente-de-santa/3005-18874/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-18874\">Vincente de Santa</a></li></ul><h3>Pre-Order Content</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/2229182-rdrlimitededition.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2229182\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.566\" data-width=\"500\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 500px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.6%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/87790/2229182-rdrlimitededition.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2229182\"><img alt=\"All three pre-order bonuses.\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2229182-rdrlimitededition.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/8/87790/2229182-rdrlimitededition.jpg 500w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/8/87790/2229182-rdrlimitededition.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2229182-rdrlimitededition.jpg 320w\"><noscript><img alt=\"All three pre-order bonuses.\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2229182-rdrlimitededition.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/8/87790/2229182-rdrlimitededition.jpg 500w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/8/87790/2229182-rdrlimitededition.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/87790/2229182-rdrlimitededition.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></noscript></a><figcaption>All three pre-order bonuses.</figcaption></figure><p>Three pieces of content for the game were originally <a href=\"/pre-order-exclusive/3015-4695/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-4695\">pre-order bonuses</a>. They were later released as downloadable content on April 12, 2011 for $0.99 each and included with the Game of the Year Edition.</p><ul><li><p><b>Deadly Assassin Outfit</b> - Adds a new single-player outfit (the Deadly Assassin Outfit) and challenges to unlock it. The outfit, which regenerates Dead-Eye twice as fast, is unlocked by searching inside Coot's Chapel, completing the Twin Rocks gang hideout, completing the Mo van Barr bounty, winning a duel in Armadillo, and completing the \"American Appetities\" Stranger side-mission. In hardcore mode, added in the Game of the Year edition, the outfit instead increases the amount of Dead-Eye gained from kills.</p></li><li><p><b>War Horse</b> - Adds a single-player deed for a new horse (the War Horse) in the player's inventory. The horse is black with a platinum mane and is one of the strongest and fastest horses in the game. In hardcore mode, added in the Game of the Year edition, the deed is not automatically added and must be purchased for $10,000.</p></li><li><p><b>Golden Guns</b> - Makes the Repeater Carbine and the Cattleman Revolver golden for Marston in single-player, granting extra fame with each kill from them. The Golden Guns Weapons Pack DLC released later made every gun in Marston's possession golden, with the exception of the Hunting Knife, Dynamite, Fire Bottles, and all other DLC weapons. The golden gun appearance can be turned on and off in any time.</p></li></ul><h4>Other retailer-specific pre-order bonuses:</h4><ul><li>An Exclusive mini guide by BradyGames</li><li>Exclusive Red Dead T-Shirt</li><li>Game Soundtrack</li><li>Official Playing Cards</li></ul><h2>Undead Nightmare (Retail Release)</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/1648222-rdrunmap.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1648222\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.73185731857319\" data-width=\"813\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 813px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:73.2%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/1648222-rdrunmap.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1648222\"><img alt=\"Undead Nightmare Map\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/1648222-rdrunmap.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/8/82063/1648222-rdrunmap.jpg 813w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/8/82063/1648222-rdrunmap.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/1648222-rdrunmap.jpg 320w\"><noscript><img alt=\"Undead Nightmare Map\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/1648222-rdrunmap.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/8/82063/1648222-rdrunmap.jpg 813w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/8/82063/1648222-rdrunmap.jpg 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/82063/1648222-rdrunmap.jpg 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></noscript></a><figcaption>Undead Nightmare Map</figcaption></figure><p>On November 23rd, 2010, Rockstar released Red Dead Redemption: Undead Nightmare to retail stores in North America. The Undead Nightmare retail disc contained all non-free DLC along with the original Free Roam Multiplayer mode as a standalone disc. Also included is a foldout poster with Undead Nightmare artwork with a map of the game world on the other side that reflects the Zombie invasion.</p><h3>In-Game Content:</h3><ul><li>Liars and Cheats</li><li>Legends and Killers</li><li>Undead Nightmare</li><li>Original Red Dead Redemption Free-Roam Multiplayer (Standalone)</li></ul><h3>Compatibility</h3><p>Players don't have to own or have played the original Red Dead Redemption to be able to play this standalone Undead Nightmare-disc content. If, however, one already has played the game and its multiplayer, their online-progress carries over into Undead Nightmare. Challenge stats, character level, playtime data, and all other stats are imported from their save file. The free DLC - \"Outlaws to the End Co-Op\" and \"Hunters and Traders\" pack are also compatible with Undead Nightmare, as well.</p><p>To ensure compatibility, one has to make sure to not mix regions (i.e.: North American Red Dead Redemption and European Undead Nightmare). The different European releases (BBFC, PEGI, USK) appear to be compatible with each other. For example, the PS3 version of Undead Nightmare from the UK (BBFC 18 rating, BLES Code 01179) works with a previously installed Red Dead Redemption from France (PEGI 18 rating, BLES Code 00680). And since both discs also carry the German USK 18 rating logo, compatibility to the German version can be considered a given.</p><p>Whether or not releases from different regions are compatible with each other is unknown but highly unlikely.</p><h3>Install</h3><p>The PS3 version of Undead Nightmare requires a minumum 2427MB install and stacks on top of previous Red Dead Redemption trophy data.</p><h2>Soundtrack</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/75011/1390899-rdr_soundtrack.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1390899\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"200\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 200px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/7/75011/1390899-rdr_soundtrack.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1390899\"><img alt=\"Red Dead Redemption OST\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 200px) 100vw, 200px\" data-width=\"200\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/7/75011/1390899-rdr_soundtrack.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/7/75011/1390899-rdr_soundtrack.jpg 200w\"><noscript><img alt=\"Red Dead Redemption OST\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/7/75011/1390899-rdr_soundtrack.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/7/75011/1390899-rdr_soundtrack.jpg 200w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 200px) 100vw, 200px\" data-width=\"200\"></noscript></a><figcaption>Red Dead Redemption OST</figcaption></figure><p>The soundtrack for Red Dead Redemption was distributed with the <a href=\"../../limited-or-collector-edition/92-1521/\" rel=\"nofollow \"> collector's edition</a> of the game. It has since been made available on iTunes, Amazon, and many other digital music stores.</p><p>Except where otherwise indicated, all music was composed and performed by Bill Elm and Woody Jackson. Bill Elm is a current member of the instrumental band Friend of Dean Martinez, while Woody Jackson is a former member of the same band. The Soundtrack was produced by David Holmes.</p><p>In August 2010, Rockstar offered a CD copy of the soundtrack for $9.99 exclusively via their own <a href=\"http://rockstarwarehouse.stores.yahoo.net/reddereorsoc.html\" rel=\"nofollow \"> Rockstar Warehouse</a>. In late November of 2010, they accepted orders for an extremely <a href=\"http://rockstarwarehouse.stores.yahoo.net/reddereorsod.html\" rel=\"nofollow \"> limited pressing</a> of the soundtrack on red vinyl and packaged in a deluxe gatefold jacket and an exclusive bonus track. The vinyl has since been sold out and might be available again at a later point in limited quantities.</p><p>RDR's soundtrack was multiple awards including the best music award at VGA 2010 and GameSpot's \"Best Original Music\".</p><table><tbody><tr><td>1.</td><td>\"Born Unto Trouble\"</td><td>3:12</td></tr><tr><td>2.</td><td>\"The Shootist\"</td><td>4:17</td></tr><tr><td>3.</td><td>\"Dead End Alley\"</td><td>2:06</td></tr><tr><td>4.</td><td>\"Horseplay\"</td><td>3:49</td></tr><tr><td>5.</td><td>\"Luz y Sombra\"</td><td>5:19</td></tr><tr><td>6.</td><td>\"El Club De Los Cuerpos\"</td><td>6:24</td></tr><tr><td>7.</td><td>\"Estancia\"</td><td>2:02</td></tr><tr><td>8.</td><td>(Theme From) Red Dead Redemption</td><td>5:38</td></tr><tr><td>9.</td><td>\"Triggernometry\"</td><td>5:23</td></tr><tr><td>10.</td><td>\"Gunplay\"</td><td><p>1:28</p></td></tr><tr><td>11.</td><td>\"Redemption In Dub\"</td><td>2:09</td></tr><tr><td>12.</td><td>\"Muertos Rojos (aka The Gunslinger's Lament)\"</td><td>5:50</td></tr><tr><td>13.</td><td>\"The Outlaw's Return\"</td><td>6:54</td></tr><tr><td>14.</td><td>\"Exodus In America\"</td><td>4:59</td></tr><tr><td>15.</td><td>\"Already Dead\"</td><td>1:31</td></tr><tr><td>16.</td><td>\"Far Away\" by Jose Gonzalez (Plays when Marston enters Mexico)</td><td>4:39</td></tr><tr><td>17.</td><td>\"Compass (Red Dead On Arrival Version)\" by Jamie Lidell (Plays after 'The Truth Will Set You Free')</td><td>2:59</td></tr><tr><td>18.</td><td>\"Deadman's Gun\" by Ashtar Command (Plays during Credits)</td><td>4:15</td></tr><tr><td>19.</td><td>\"Bury Me Not On The Lone Prairie\" by William Elliot Whitmore (Plays after 'The Last Enemy That Shall Be Destroyed')</td><td>2:24</td></tr><tr><td>20.</td><td>\"Old Friends, New Problems\"**</td><td> </td></tr></tbody></table><p>** = Track 20. is exclusive to the vinyl release of the soundtrack</p><h3>Undead Nightmare Soundtrack</h3><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/1647537-rdrunost.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1647537\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"1\" data-width=\"280\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 280px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:100.0%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/82063/1647537-rdrunost.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-1647537\"><img alt=\"Undead Nightmare OST\" src=\"data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAAAAACH5BAEKAAEALAAAAAABAAEAAAICTAEAOw==\" sizes=\"(max-width: 280px) 100vw, 280px\" data-width=\"280\" class=\"js-lazy-load-image\" data-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/8/82063/1647537-rdrunost.jpg\" data-srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/8/82063/1647537-rdrunost.jpg 280w\"><noscript><img alt=\"Undead Nightmare OST\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/8/82063/1647537-rdrunost.jpg\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/8/82063/1647537-rdrunost.jpg 280w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 280px) 100vw, 280px\" data-width=\"280\"></noscript></a><figcaption>Undead Nightmare OST</figcaption></figure><p>On November 23rd, Rockstar made the soundtrack to the Undead Nightmare DLC available for purchase in digital form. It can be found on Amazon, iTunes, and similar stores. A physical disc release was made available exclusively via the Rockstar Warehouse.</p><p>Composition was again handled by Bill Elm and Woody Jackson.</p><table><tbody><tr><td>1.</td><td>Undead Nightmare</td><td>Bill Elm &amp; Woody Jackson</td><td>1:07</td></tr><tr><td>2.</td><td>Zombie Corpseplay</td><td>Bill Elm &amp; Woody Jackson</td><td>2:53</td></tr><tr><td>3.</td><td>Get Back In That Hole, Partner</td><td>Bill Elm &amp; Woody Jackson</td><td>2:36</td></tr><tr><td>4.</td><td>Army of Undead</td><td>Bill Elm &amp; Woody Jackson</td><td>2:23</td></tr><tr><td>5.</td><td>Chupacabra</td><td>Bill Elm &amp; Woody Jackson</td><td>3:19</td></tr><tr><td>6.</td><td>Zombie Peyote</td><td>Bill Elm &amp; Woody Jackson</td><td>1:41</td></tr><tr><td>7.</td><td>Ojo Muerto</td><td>Bill Elm &amp; Woody Jackson</td><td>1:49</td></tr><tr><td>8.</td><td>Blunderbuss Blues</td><td>Bill Elm &amp; Woody Jackson</td><td>1:58</td></tr><tr><td>9.</td><td>Four Horses Of The Apocalypse</td><td>Bill Elm &amp; Woody Jackson</td><td>5:03</td></tr><tr><td>10.</td><td>Blackwater, U.S.A.</td><td>Bill Elm &amp; Woody Jackson</td><td>5:21</td></tr><tr><td>11.</td><td>Undead Redemption</td><td>Bill Elm &amp; Woody Jackson</td><td>1:42</td></tr><tr><td>12.</td><td>Missing Souls</td><td>Bill Elm &amp; Woody Jackson</td><td>1:32</td></tr><tr><td>13.</td><td>A Man Ready For Anything</td><td>Bill Elm &amp; Woody Jackson</td><td>1:57</td></tr><tr><td>14.</td><td>Showdown At Escalera</td><td>Bill Elm &amp; Woody Jackson</td><td>2:43</td></tr><tr><td>15.</td><td>Bad Voodoo</td><td>Kreeps</td><td>3:41</td></tr><tr><td>16.</td><td>Dead Man Walking</td><td>Kreeps</td><td>3:52</td></tr><tr><td>17.</td><td>Dead Sled</td><td>Kreeps</td><td>2:09</td></tr><tr><td>18.</td><td>Stinkin' Zombies</td><td>Misterio</td><td>3:11</td></tr></tbody></table>",

        "site_detail_url": "https://www.giantbomb.com/red-dead-redemption/3030-25249/"

    {
        "aliases": "Cyberpunk 77",
        "api_detail_url": "https://www.giantbomb.com/api/game/3030-38456/",
        "date_added": "2012-05-30 10:24:47",
        "date_last_updated": "2024-09-18 15:23:03",
        "deck": "An open-world action role-playing game by CD Projekt RED based on the pen and paper RPG Cyberpunk 2020.",
        "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><figure data-align=\"right\" data-img-src=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/81005/2222160-2222074_cdpred_new_rpg_less.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2222160\" data-size=\"small\" data-ratio=\"0.514\" data-width=\"2000\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 2000px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:51.4%\" href=\"https://static.giantbomb.com/uploads/original/8/81005/2222160-2222074_cdpred_new_rpg_less.png\" data-ref-id=\"1300-2222160\"><img alt=\"Concept art\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/81005/2222160-2222074_cdpred_new_rpg_less.png\" srcset=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/original/8/81005/2222160-2222074_cdpred_new_rpg_less.png 2000w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/8/81005/2222160-2222074_cdpred_new_rpg_less.png 960w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/8/81005/2222160-2222074_cdpred_new_rpg_less.png 480w, https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_small/8/81005/2222160-2222074_cdpred_new_rpg_less.png 320w\" sizes=\"(max-width: 320px) 100vw, 320px\" data-width=\"320\"></a><figcaption>Concept art</figcaption></figure><p>Cyberpunk 2077 is a role-playing game by <a href=\"/cd-projekt-red-sp-z-oo/3010-2890/\" data-ref-id=\"3010-2890\">CD Projekt RED</a>. It was announced on May 30, 2012 during CD Projekt's Summer Conference live-stream. The development team includes veterans of <a href=\"/the-witcher/3030-10473/\" data-ref-id=\"3030-10473\">The Witcher</a> and <a href=\"/the-witcher-2-assassins-of-kings/3030-28178/\" data-ref-id=\"3030-28178\">The Witcher 2</a> teams at CD Projekt RED.</p><p>Not much has been revealed about the fundamental gameplay, but CD Projekt has shared a few details. Players will be able to create and customize their own characters including different classes, which are said to impact the story. Both the story and structure of the game will be non-linear. The game will use a combination of both first person and third person views.</p><p>Multiplayer features are also confirmed; however, the developer claims that it will nevertheless be a \"story-based RPG experience,\" with \"amazing single-player play-throughs.\"</p><p>CD Projekt Red have confirmed that Cyberpunk 2077 will be made using REDengine 3, the same engine used for <a href=\"/the-witcher-3-wild-hunt/3030-41484/\" data-ref-id=\"3030-41484\">The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt</a>.</p><p>During <a href=\"/e3-2018/3015-9042/\" data-ref-id=\"3015-9042\">E3 2018</a> CD Projekt RED announced that the game will be a shooter played from the first-person perspective, shifting to third person during cutscenes. There will also be an option to switch to a third person camera when driving. A work-in-progress <a href=\"https://youtu.be/vjF9GgrY9c0\" rel=\"nofollow \">gameplay video</a> was released to the public in August 2018.</p><p>Cyberpunk was officially released December 10, 2020. After a rocky launch, on December 17, 2020 Sony Interactive Entertainment removed the game from their storefront and began offering unconditional refunds to all purchasers. Industry insiders described this as \"unprecedented\" and \"a huge yikes.\"</p><h2>PC System Requirements</h2><h3>Revised - Version 2.0, or later</h3><figure data-align=\"left\" data-size=\"medium\" data-img-src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/5/56742/3606735-7893412572-e4fde.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-3606735\" data-ratio=\"0.5625\" data-width=\"3840\" data-embed-type=\"image\" style=\"width: 3840px\"><a class=\"fluid-height\" style=\"padding-bottom:56.3%\" href=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/5/56742/3606735-7893412572-e4fde.jpg\" data-ref-id=\"1300-3606735\"><img alt=\"No Caption Provided\" src=\"https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_super/5/56742/3606735-7893412572-e4fde.jpg\"             "medium_url": "https://www.giantbomb.com/a/uploads/scale_medium/20/201266/3532837-0378849544-co5s5.png",

        "resource_type": "game",
        "site_detail_url": "https://www.giantbomb.com/god-of-war-ragnarok/3030-80643/"
    },
    {
        "aliases": "WatchDogs\r\nWatch_Dogs",
        "api_detail_url": "https://www.giantbomb.com/api/game/3030-38538/",
        "date_added": "2012-06-04 16:20:44",
        "date_last_updated": "2022-04-29 17:34:27",
        "deck": "A third-person open-world game from Ubisoft, set in an alternate version of Chicago where the entire city is connected under a single network, and a vigilante named Aiden Pearce uses it to fight back against a conspiracy.",
        "description": "<h2>Overview</h2><p>Watch Dogs (styled Watch_Dogs in marketing) follows <a href=\"//www.giantbomb.com/aiden-pearce/3005-23427/\" data-ref-id=\"3005-23427\">Aiden Pearce</a>, a hacker who can control the electrical grid and other systems in the city of <a href=\"/chicago/3035-293/\" data-ref-id=\"3035-293\">Chicago</a>. He possesses mobile hacking technology, which allows him to match people's real life identities with their online presences on the fly; he can also shut down mobile phone reception and listen in on phone calls.</p><p>Players can also take on the roles of other Watch Dogs and protect Aiden as he is chased by police. Multiple players exist in the city at one time, although when this multiplayer triggers or what other players would be doing when Aiden is not in trouble is unclear.</p><h2>Gameplay</h2><p>Aiden has multiple smart-phone abilities that affect the environment of the entire city. He can hack into almost any device nearby or via camera feed to do anything from gathering information, to skimming money from their bank account, to distracting or even killing enemies. He can stop trains, raise bridges and security barriers, overload nearby fuse boxes, or black out the entire city for a short period of time to allow him to sneak by or evade enemies. In some parts of the game, he can direct companions through stealth sequences, making use of his hacking abilities to help them through to the goal.</p><p>In combat, Aiden can wield a large variety of weapons including pistols, shotguns, submachineguns, assault rifles, sniper rifles, and even a grenade launcher. He can slow down time to shoot through his special Focus ability that recharges slowly on its own. He can instantly knock out single enemies in melee range with a telescoping police baton.</p><p>As the game progresses, Aiden can learn to craft ability items through parts he picks up or purchases from shops. Everything from remote-controlled IEDs, to communications-jamming devices, to Focus-boosting pills, to a ctOS scanner that can instantly ping all nearby enemies.</p><p>Aiden also carries a persistent reputation meter through the story. When he completes contracts and performs heroic actions, the public will side with him and not call for the police. If Aiden performs enough negative actions, like killing civilians or robbing stores, Aiden's picture will appear on the news and more Chicago citizens will call the police when they see him. Aiden can run up and grab the caller's phone or use his Jam Coms ability to cut off the call.</p><p>In the world itself, Aiden can take on side missions in the form of Fixer Contracts, conduct Investigations into the seedier parts of Chicago, or use his Profiler to find and stop criminal attacks just before they happen. For money, or just for fun, Aiden can compete in drinking games, poker games, slot machines, chess matches, and even a shell game.</p><p>Aiden can take control of a wide variety of vehicles to get around Chicago, including several different kinds of cars or trucks, motorcycles, and even boats, all through hacking them with ctOS. Aiden can hijack cars like the protagonist of a <a href=\"/grand-theft-auto/3025-6/\" data-ref-id=\"3025-6\">Grand Theft Auto</a> game, or call on Jordi to leave a \"pre-owned\" copy of a requested vehicle nearby.</p><h3>Online Contracts</h3><p>Another aspect of Watch_Dogs is the online hacking, where other players can drop into the game as enemy Fixers, and vice-versa. The player sees themselves as Aiden, while the opponent sees them as another randomly-generated character. There are multiple types of Online Contracts:</p><ul><li>ctOS Mobile Challenge: One player uses an iPhone or Android app to take control of a CPD helicopter and try to stop the other player, playing Aiden Pearce, from reaching a goal by calling in various police resources and hacking abilities to stop them. This is the only Online Contract that requires both players to permit the other to invade.</li><li>Online Free Roam: Up to 8 players can join a single session and do whatever they please in Chicago.</li><li>Online Decryption: 4-8 players are split into 2 teams of Fixers. One team must grab the file and hold it to decrypt it while the enemy team must kill the file-holder to finish decrypting it themselves. More teammates near the file-holder helps to decrypt the file faster.</li><li>Online Race: 3-8 players compete in a race around Chicago in one of several varieties of vehicles, including boats and motorcycles.</li><li>Online Hacking: An invading Fixer has five minutes to locate their enemy and start installing a backdoor virus into their phone. The invaded player must then use their Profiler to find the enemy withing a shrinking area before they finish hacking and kill them. If the invader tries to kill the enemy before the download is complete, they automatically lose.</li><li>Online Tailing: Similar to Online Hacking, the invading Fixer must tail the enemy within a certain radius of them without being spotted until their meter reaches 100%. Unlike Online Hacking, the player is not restricted to a small area of the map. The invaded fixer must identify their attacker and then kill them. If the invader is discovered, they can kill their quarry or escape for partial success.</li></ul><h2>Story</h2><p>In 2013, a \"Fixer\" named Aiden Pierce lives and works in Chicago, using his great hacking skills to skim money and information from anyone he needs through a system called \"ctOS\" (Centralized Operating System) that has connected the entire city in one gigantic network. However, after stumbling on some important data he wasn't supposed to find, Aiden's niece is killed in a hit-and-run that was meant for him.</p><p>Aiden's quest for revenge on both the killer and the people who hired him takes him across Chicago, putting him at odds with an old-school mob boss, an Iraq war veteran, a hacktivist from \"DedSec,\" and a disgruntled former employee of the Blume Corporation who originally designed ctOS.</p><h2>Bad Blood</h2><p>About one year after the events of the main Watch Dogs story, Aiden and T-Bone both plan to flee from Chicago and the eyes of ctOS. However, T-Bone receives a panicked call from Tobias Frewer, former Blume colleague and co-creator of ctOS who has become homeless and mentally unstable, as he's kidnapped by Fixers working for Blume. T-Bone reluctantly finds himself staying in Chicago to help Tobias and tie up a few loose ends before he can leave Chicago for good.</p><p>Similar to Aiden, T-Bone can hack connected devices, and acquire and equip the same weapons as Aiden. T-Bone also has a special RC car that can be used to scout ahead, knock out enemies, and extend his hacking range. T-Bone also can carry out \"Street Sweeper\" missions, similar to Aiden's Fixer Contracts, that can be used to gain money, experience points, and other special perks. Some of these missions can be played in co-op mode with another player online, or repeated to get a higher score on the Leaderboards.</p><h2>E3 Demonstrations</h2><p>When the game was announced at the Ubisoft E3 2012 conference, a lengthy gameplay demonstration was shown. In this demonstration, the protagonist is shown controlling the electricity grid, which allows him to manipulate street lights. This power was used to create a pile-up to entrap a digital artist named Joseph Demarco. Another section of the demo shows him trying to gain access to a building. In order to distract the guard at the door he shuts down communications in that area of the city at which point calls are cut off for NPC's. This causes enough confusion that the guard effectively abandons his post and allows the player into the building.</p><p>At Sony's Playstation Meeting where they revealed the PS4, Ubisoft played through a brief open-world section of the game. \"There is no mission,\" they said, as Aiden walked the streets of Chicago. Most NPCs he encountered had dossiers projected for Aiden to see, revealing a homeless man to be an Iraq War veteran and a suited man to be a Tobacco Executive and Pro Life activist. Using a radial menu Aiden hacks the suited man's bank account and takes out of a nearby ATM.</p><p>Aiden cannot control everything. A security camera run by another entity was marked in red and secure. He can, however, using background histories and probabilities, detect the likelihood of events. Because a woman who had recently won a child custody battle was walking near an alley where her former husband was waiting, a crime probability bar began filling up as she walked toward the ambush. Aiden had the choice to help her and he did, interceding when the man put her at knife point. There is then an optional chase sequence where cops are alerted due to gun fire. In an alley, Aiden takes control of an electrical panel, overheats it, and takes down the man. To escape the cops, he stops an El-Line train and hops aboard.</p><p>As well as Aiden's ability to use technology to hack into systems and manipulate electrical devices, he can also employ many other skills to accomplish his goals. These include sneaking around environments and hiding behind cover, parkour-like actions to quickly traverse the city, and the ability to slow down time.</p><p>At the Sony Press Conference at E3 2013, another gameplay demo showed Pierce navigating an alerted city in order to save his colleague T-Bone from discovery. Pierce drove his car stealthily through the city streets, using the mini-map and environmental awareness to avoid patrolling police vehicles. When spotted by a helicopter search light, however, he drove to a hidden parking garage on Chicago's Lower Wacker Drive, losing the cops and taking the back entrance into a humming coffee shop. However, due to his raised alert status, the TV in the shop projected his image and Pierce had to smash the cell phone of a patron calling 911. This sequence demonstrated the real-world impact of a raised alert, where even after breaking line of sight the player must be cautious as any TV could begin the chase anew.</p><p>Pierce reaches his destination of a nondescript building where he hacks into the security cameras, then into a laptop camera to locate T-Bone, who has found a piece of computer hardware that impresses him. Pierce appears to need line of sight in order to hack and affect the world, but he can gain it through any camera in the world. In this case, he sees a screen array that he can turn on to distract the guard and give T-Bone an exit. Pierce then takes on a squad-command role as he directs T-Bone across a courtyard patrolled by guards, with T-Bone following the player's commands. Pierce can turn the lights on the parked cars on to distract guards as well.</p><p>However, they are discovered as they escape and Pierce kills a private security man before being sighted by a police helicopter.</p><p>The \"second-screen\" functionality was then revealed further as Pierce called for a random mobile user's help. This user, on a tablet, is playing at the CtOS system itself. The user shuts down the helicopter's systems for a second, momentarily disabling it but not destroying it, giving Pierce the time to get away.</p><p>He runs into some cops, though, and must employ more gadgetry. On his smart-phone select screen of abilities, he chooses total blackout, which kills every light in the city. He then uses his unexplained slow motion power to aim and shoot out the cop's knee caps before escaping on a boat down the Chicago river</p><h2>Special Editions</h2><table System:</strong> Windows Vista (SP2), Windows 7 (SP1) or Windows 8 <ul><li>64 bit OSs only.</li></ul></li><li><strong>DVD-ROM:</strong> DVD-ROM Dual Layer</li><li><strong>Hard Drive Space:</strong> 20 GB</li><li><strong>Sound:</strong> DirectX 9.0c compatible sound card with latest drivers</li><li><strong>Internet:</strong> Broadband connection and service required for multiplayer mode</li></ul><h3>Minimum</h3><ul><li><strong>GPU:</strong> DirectX 11 graphics card with 1 GB Video RAM</li><li><strong>CPU:</strong> Quad core</li><li><strong>RAM:</strong> 4GB</li></ul><h4>Example 1</h4><ul><li><strong>GPU:</strong> NVidia GTX 460</li><li><strong>CPU:</strong> Intel Core2 Quad Q6600</li></ul><h4>Example 2</h4><ul><li><strong>GPU:</strong> AMD Radeon HD 5770</li><li><strong>CPU:</strong> AMD Phenom X4 9750</li></ul><h3>Recommended</h3><ul><li><strong>GPU:</strong> DirectX 11 graphics card with 2 GB Video RAM</li><li><strong>CPU:</strong> Eight core</li><li><strong>RAM:</strong> 8GB</li></ul><h4>Example 1</h4><ul><li><strong>GPU:</strong> NVidia GTX 760</li><li><strong>CPU:</strong> Intel Core i7-3770</li></ul><h4>Example 2</h4><ul><li><strong>GPU: </strong>AMD Radeon R9 270X</li><li><strong>CPU:</strong> AMD FX-8350 Eight-Core</li></ul><h3>Ultra</h3><ul><li><strong>GPU:</strong> Latest DirectX 11 graphics card with 3 GB Video RAM or more</li><li><strong>CPU:</strong> Latest Eight core or more</li><li><strong>RAM:</strong> 8GB or more</li></ul><h4>Example 1</h4><ul><li><strong>GPU:</strong> Nvidia GTX 780 Ti</li><li><strong>CPU:</strong> Intel Core i7-3930K</li></ul><h4>Example 2</h4><ul><li><strong>GPU:</strong> AMD Radeon R9 290X</li><li><strong>CPU:</strong> AMD FX-9370 Eight-Core</li></ul>",
